data.title: Wisconsin Scholarship Hub (WiSH)
data.text:
William F. Allen Prize

The William F. Allen Prize is awarded by the Department of History for the best historical essays of term-paper size and scope. Up to three prizes of $200 each will be awarded annually. No more than one of the prizes may be awarded to a non-History major.

How to Apply

Students will be considered for the William F. Allen Prize by completing the Department of History Undergraduate Writing Prize Application in WiSH.

For questions about this award, please contact: undergraduateprogram@history.wisc.edu.
